revision.text:
{{wiktionary|apple|Apple}} An '''[[apple]]''' is a pomaceous edible fruit of a temperate-zone deciduous tree.
'''Apple''', '''apples''', or '''APPLE''' may also refer to: {{TOC right}}
==Botany== * [[List of apple cultivars]] * [[Cashew apple]], the fruit that grows with the cashew nut * [[Custard apple]], several fruits * [[Hedge apple]] (''Maclura pomifera'') * [[Love apple]]: ** ''[[Syzygium samarangense]]'', a plant species in the family Myrtaceae ** [[Tomato]] * ''[[Malus]]'', the genus of all apples and crabapples * [[Mammee apple (disambiguation)]] * [[May apple]] (''Podophyllum peltatum'') * [[Oak apple]], a type of gall that grows on oak trees * [[Rose apple (disambiguation)]], several fruits * [[Thorn apple (disambiguation)]]: ** ''[[Crataegus]]'' species ** ''[[Datura]]'' species * [[Wax apple]] (''Syzygium samarangense'')
==Places== ===Switzerland=== * [[Apples, Vaud]], a municipality
===United States=== * [[Apple, Oklahoma]], an unincorporated community * [[Apple Creek (Mississippi River)]] * [[Apple Island (Massachusetts)]], a former island * [[Apple Island (Michigan)]] * [[Apple River (Illinois)]], a tributary of the Mississippi River * [[Apple River (Wisconsin)]], a tributary of the St. Croix River
==People with the name== * [[Apple (name)]], a list of people and fictional characters with the surname, given name or nickname * [[Candy Apples]] (born 1976), American pornographic actress
==Arts, entertainment, and media== ===Films=== * [[The Apple (1980 film)|''The Apple'' (1980 film)]], a 1980 musical science fiction film * [[The Apple (1998 film)|''The Apple'' (1998 film)]], by Samira Makhmalbaf
===Music=== ====Groups and labels==== * [[Apple (band)]], a British psychedelic rock band * [[Apple Records]], a record label founded by the Beatles * [[The Apples (Israeli band)]], a mid 2000s Israeli funk band * [[The Apples (Scottish band)]], an early 1990s Scottish indie-dance band * [[The Apples in Stereo]], an American rock band originally called The Apples
====Albums==== * [[Apple (album)|''Apple'' (album)]], a 1990 album by Mother Love Bone * [[Apples (album)|''Apples'' (album)]], a 1989 album by Ian Dury
===Other uses in arts, entertainment, and media=== * [[The Apple (Star Trek: The Original Series)|"The Apple" (''Star Trek: The Original Series'')]], a 1967 episode from the second series * ''[[Apple Daily]]'', a Hong-Kong-based newspaper * [[Apples (card game)]] * [[Apples (novel)|''Apples'' (novel)]], by Richard Milward * "Apples", a song by Lily Allen from ''[[No Shame (Lily Allen album)|No Shame]]''
==Brands and enterprises== * [[Apple (automobile)]], an American automobile manufactured by Apple Automobile Company from 1917 to 1918 * [[Apple Bank]], an American bank in the New York City area * [[Apple Corps]], a multimedia corporation founded in the 1960s by The Beatles * [[Apple Inc.]], a US-based consumer electronics and software company founded in 1976 ** [[Apple I]], a computer by Apple Computer (now Apple Inc.) in 1976 ** [[Apple II]], a home computer introduced in 1977 ** [[Apple II series]], a family of home computers introduced in 1977 ** [[Apple III]], a business-oriented personal computer starting in 1978 ** [[Apple Macintosh]], a series of personal computers ** [[Apple Store]], a chain of retail stores owned and operated by Apple Inc. * [[Apple Leisure Group]], an American travel and hotel management company
===Computing and technology=== * [[Apple key]], on Apple computers * [[Apple Pugetsound Program Library Exchange]] (A.P.P.L.E.) * [[Ariane Passenger Payload Experiment]] (APPLE), an Indian experimental communication satellite launched in 1981 * [[HP Apple]], a virtual CPU in certain Hewlett-Packard programmable calculators emulating the HP Yorke processor ** Not to be confused with [[Apple iPod+HP]], an HP-branded version of Apple's portable digital media player
==Other uses== * [[Apple (symbolism)]] * [[Apple Cup]], the annual college football game between the University of Washington and Washington State University * ''[[Yabloko]]'' (Apple), a political party in Russia founded in 1993
==See also== * [[Apel (disambiguation)]] * [[Appel (disambiguation)]] * [[APPEL (disambiguation)]] * [[Apple TV (disambiguation)]] * [[Big Apple (disambiguation)]] * [[Timeline of Apple Inc. products]]
{{disambiguation|geo|plant}}
